> DH will be working in town. Where are some good areas outside of Abq
> that

> read

> alot or a little? rain was about <9 inches. I know we'll have to

> Summer here in DC is hot, humid and about 2 1/2 months of swimming

> The growing season here is May-Sept. Is it longer there?
> These are all teh questions the 1000's of websites don't really answer!
> Elissa, who is not excited at all, really.

Mimi

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] New Mexico
messages.msgSnippet: Great laws! Only 2-3 more portfolio reviews here in MD and then NO HASSLES!! Where in NM are you Joy? We ll be moving to Albuquerque. We want to buy a patch of
messages.messageBody:
Great laws! Only 2-3 more portfolio reviews here in MD and then NO HASSLES!!
Where in NM are you Joy? We'll be moving to Albuquerque. We want to buy a
patch of land outside of town, say 10-20 acres and do dome neo-homesteading.
DH will be working in town. Where are some good areas outside of Abq that
have a commute of no more than 30 minutes? And how is the weather? I read
all the yearly temp charts but don't really know how to apply them. for
example winter (Feb.) says a high of 42* and low 22* does that mean snow?
alot or a little? rain was about <9 inches. I know we'll have to irrigate.
Summer here in DC is hot, humid and about 2 1/2 months of swimming weather.
The growing season here is May-Sept. Is it longer there?
These are all teh questions the 1000's of websites don't really answer!
Elissa, who is not excited at all, really.

><Is there anyone on this list from New Mexico? Is there much interference
>from
>the government? >
>No testing, register online, if you don't register there is no one on the
>payroll to come after you.
>We be bop all over town and never been hasseled. Losts of land to buy.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] New Mexico
messages.msgSnippet: Mimi, You should go to the NHEN boards and look up the homeschooling laws for the states you are interested in. Lynda ... From: groundhoggirl
messages.messageBody:
Mimi,

You should go to the NHEN boards and look up the homeschooling laws for the
states you are interested in.

Lynda

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] New Mexico
messages.msgSnippet: No testing, register online, if you don t register there is
messages.messageBody:
<Is there anyone on this list from New Mexico? Is there much interference
from
the government? >
No testing, register online, if you don't register there is no one on the
payroll to come after you.
We be bop all over town and never been hasseled. Losts of land to buy.


Learn from others but go to your own school
Joy in NM
hs sahm of two, Michael and Kenna
*
*

messages.messageBody:
My family is moving there in the next 1-2 years. From what I understand of
the law there, you send a letter of intent and that's it. The perfect place
for unschoolers!
Elissa

messages.subject: New Mexico
messages.msgSnippet: Is there anyone on this list from New Mexico?  We are considering moving within 2 years and my husband is interested in New Mexico.  Are you comfortable
messages.messageBody:
Is there anyone on this list from New Mexico? We are considering moving
within 2 years and my husband is interested in New Mexico. Are you
comfortable unschooling in New Mexico? Is there much interference from
the government?

Mimi
